summary: Nintendo Has Confirmed That The E3 2019 Direct Will Be "Around 40 Minutes"
title: Nintendo Has Confirmed That The E3 2019 Direct Will Be "Around 40 Minutes"
body:
Nintendo Has Confirmed That The E3 2019 Direct Will Be “Around 40 Minutes”

The NicoNicoLive page’s information was true. Nintendo has officially confirmed that the company’s E3 2019 Direct, which is slated to take place at 9am Pacific/12pm Eastern, will be around 40 minutes long. Unsurprisingly, the focus will be about Switch games releasing this year. You can see Nintendo’s official tweet for yourself down below.

https://twitter.com/NintendoAmerica/status/113785690149…

View On WordPress

summary: Was playing this a little while ago, hadn’t touched it since a friend gave it to me almost 20 years ago. Couldn’t remember why I...
body: Was playing this a little while ago, hadn’t touched it since a friend gave it to me almost 20 years ago. Couldn’t remember why I never played it again and man do I see why now, it’s so frustrating I rage quit like a 12 year old. Got all the way to the final boss and if you die at him you get sent back to a checkpoint that’s minutes away. That combined with how horribly slow your character moves and all the enemies that are faster than you, you’ll get to the boss with only 1 or 2 hits left. I never understood why they only managed a single good Castlevania out of the three Game Boy titles, Castlevania 2: Belmont’s Revenge.

That combined with how horribly slow your character moves and all the enemies that are faster than you, you’ll get to the boss with only 1 or 2 hits left. I never understood why they only managed a single good Castlevania out of the three Game Boy titles, Castlevania 2: Belmont’s Revenge.

That combined with how horribly slow your character moves and all the enemies that are faster than you, you’ll get to the boss with only 1 or 2 hits left. I never understood why they only managed a single good Castlevania out of the three Game Boy titles, Castlevania 2: Belmont’s Revenge.

That combined with how horribly slow your character moves and all the enemies that are faster than you, you’ll get to the boss with only 1 or 2 hits left. I never understood why they only managed a single good Castlevania out of the three Game Boy titles, Castlevania 2: Belmont’s Revenge.

tags: i think about this every goddamn day
summary: Imagine that you have been given a message by an alien entity, telling you that you have been recognized for your power and...
body:
Imagine that you have been given a message by an alien entity, telling you that you have been recognized for your power and talent and have been summoned to a great tournament, filled with heroes from across space and time.

Imagine then that when you get to this tournament, you discover that you are the only human and that 80% of the other fighters are velociraptors.

That is what the Inklings have to deal with.

reblog.comment:

summary: Minecraft: Dungeons, la nueva aventura de acción
title: Minecraft: Dungeons, la nueva aventura de acción
body:
Minecraft: Dungeons es la nueva entrega de acción y aventura totalmente ambientada en los clásicos dungeon crawler, y será un juego que llegará a Xbox One, PC y Nintendo Switch. El título tiene una mejora visual con una iluminación interesante aunque no sabemos si tiene elementos de construcción o si se trata de un dungeon […]

La entrada Minecraft: Dungeons, la nueva aventura de acción aparece primero en Versus Media México | Videojuegos, Cine, Tecnología, TV, Cultura..

blog.name: earthsong9405
blog.title: Meh Stoofs c:
blog.description: Welcome, folks, to my personal trash can. uwu Nah I'm just jokin'; this blog is mainly for my artwork where you can see original content, animation, fanart, commissions, and me spewing pages and pages of headcanon for things I like. Hope ya'll enjoy! c:

summary: Some very rough concept sketches for my LoZ headcanon timeline: New Mythos. Finally have a name for it! <: Anyway, I...
caption:
Some very rough concept sketches for my LoZ headcanon timeline: New Mythos. Finally have a name for it! <:

Anyway, I love focusing the work on the characters but I also wanna explore the environment the characters habitat. BG work isn’t my strongest suit but I enjoy it and wanna improve on it, so these are halfway practice but mostly me trying to capture what I see in my head.

So context! When Link, Zelda, and Gandondorf answer the call to adventure, they are tasked with journeying to the forbidden lands of Old Hyrule. Old Hyrule is the vast landscape all of the other LoZ games took place in, with BotW marking the final instance civilization thrived there. After Demise’s Malice is struck down the entirety of the inhabitants decided it safer to move themselves entirely, mostly out of extreme precaution in case Demise’s death isn’t so “dead”, as it were.

So! One vast ocean and magical barrier later, Old Hyrule is cut off from the rest of the world, as the final resting place of the biggest scourge of the world and a forbidden land that can be seen from afar. If you want the full explanation behind my thoughts on this here’s the links to the posts going a bit more into detail: Here, and Here

Top right sketch is of a cliff that gives the best view of Old Hyrule: nothing more than a faded silhouette with it’s volcano still active as it always has been. The top left is a rough idea of how the beach of Old Hyrule’s Gateway looks like: a thin stretch of an island with shallow sea water and nothing dotting its landscape but the carcasses of destroyed sunken ships and the actual gate itself. Old Hyrule’s Gateway is on an island that sits just before the rest of Old Hyrule itself, the only stretch of land right outside the very transparent barrier that closes the Old Hyrule in. 

To reach this island is a dangerous (near suicidal) quest by boat, and very rarely does anyone actually reach it. But if one does, the last obstacle is to activate the actual gateway itself, but the only way to do that is with a specific key.

The bottom two is an exploration on how that gateway looks like while dormant and inactive: when dormant the gateway glows blue and there is no bridge that allows passage through the barrier itself. For anyone without access this would spell the end of their journey: no one can pass the barrier just as much as nothing can get out of it.

But, if that person has the key necessary to activate the bridge, the gateway will glow a brilliant orange and a bridge of solid magic will form to connect the island to Old Hyrule itself. And it will mark the start of a long journey for our heroes.

———————-

Aaaaaaaaaaand there we go! Got a bit long-winded there since I didn’t do more concept sketches, but I think I’ll add more to better illustrate how I see it! Until then, I hope ya’ll enjoy! <:

blog.name: piermanwalter
blog.title: We put way too much effort into pointless things.
blog.description: This blog has two mods. It is difficult to tell which is which.

summary: People who started playing Animal Crossing as a child: Tom Nook is an evil capitalist abomination. Stop putting people in debt....
body:
People who started playing Animal Crossing as a child: Tom Nook is an evil capitalist abomination. Stop putting people in debt. He has trapped all of us in an endless cycle of forced labor.

People who started playing Animal Crossing as an adult: Tom Nook is a chill guy. Adopts street kids, gives me a free house I can pay for if I feel like. Redd can go to hell, though.

reblog.comment:
People who started playing Animal Crossing as a child: Tom Nook is an evil capitalist abomination. Stop putting people in debt. He has trapped all of us in an endless cycle of forced labor.

summary: The only games that interest me in 2019/2020
body:
The only games that interest me in 2019/2020

Now I’m only going for games that have release dates, so since Psychonauts 2 and Ghostbusters videogame remake doesn’t have a release date is not on the list. I will be updating this with updated games since E3 2019 is going on. And right now I don’t have a job or a Xbox, so just things available on the Playstation or Switch.

  • Death Stranding
  • Borderlands 3
  • Jedi Fallen Order
  • Control
  • Outer Worlds
  • Cyberpunk 2077
